April 2025 County of Marin EMS ALS PR 8
NEEDLE THORACOSTOMY/
PLEURAL DECOMPRESSION
PROCEDURE
Indications
To relieve tension pneumothorax as indicated by a combination of the following:
• Severe dyspnea and/or difficulty with ventilation, especially with an intubated patient
• ALOC and/or agitation
• Absent or unequal breath sounds on affected side
• Signs of shock, rapid deterioration of vital signs
• Neck vein distention
• Paradoxical movement of the chest
• Hyper-resonance to percussion on the affected side
• Tracheal shift away from the affected side
Procedure Preparation Equipment
• Choose appropriate site on the affected side: • 14g or larger ≥ 3 inches
• If patient head is elevated, locate the second • Heimlich or other one-way valve
intercostal space, mid-clavicular line • 10ml syringe
• If patient is flat, locate the 4th intercostal space,
anterior-axillary line
• Prepare site with Betadine or chlorhexidine
• Attach the large gauge IV needle to a large syringe
Mid-Clavicular
Line
Procedure
• With the patient exhaling, introduce the needle at a
90º angle, just over the rib at the selected site
2nd Intercostal,
• Advancing slightly superior to the rib, continue until above 3rd rib
lack of resistance or a “pop” is felt as the needle
enters the pleural space
4th Intercostal,
above 5th rib
• If the air and/or blood returns under
pressure or is easily aspirated,
continue to advance the catheter
Anterior- Axillary
superiorly and remove the needle
Line
• When no further air escapes, attach
a one-way valve
• Secure the catheter with the valve in
a dependent position
• Reassess patient
